segment.source: Device Dialog Box (Windows 10)
segment.target: Device Dialog Box (Windows 10)

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), the Device dialog box shows information about the selected device.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), the Device dialog box shows information about the selected device.

segment.source: Device Dialog Box
segment.target: Device Dialog Box

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), the Device dialog box shows information about the selected device.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), the Device dialog box shows information about the selected device.

segment.source: To open the Device dialog box
segment.target: To open the Device dialog box

segment.source: In ACM, in the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.
segment.target: In ACM, in the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.

segment.source: Under an operating system heading, click Devices.
segment.target: Under an operating system heading, click Devices.

segment.source: Double-click the name of a device.
segment.target: Double-click the name of a device.

segment.source: Tabs in the Device dialog box
segment.target: Tabs in the Device dialog box

segment.source: The following table shows the information available in the Device dialog box.
segment.target: The following table shows the information available in the Device dialog box.

segment.source: Tab
segment.target: Tab

segment.source: Information
segment.target: Information

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Shows the following information for the selected device:
segment.target: Shows the following information for the selected device:

segment.source: The model and manufacturer of the device.
segment.target: The model and manufacturer of the device.

segment.source: The class of device, as reported by the device.
segment.target: The class of device, as reported by the device.

segment.source: An evaluation of whether the device works on a 32-bit operating system or a 64-bit operating system.
segment.target: An evaluation of whether the device works on a 32-bit operating system or a 64-bit operating system.

segment.source: Computers
segment.target: Computers

segment.source: Shows the following information for each of the computers on which the device is installed:
segment.target: Shows the following information for each of the computers on which the device is installed:

segment.source: Computer name, domain, and operating system.
segment.target: Computer name, domain, and operating system.

segment.source: The count of installed applications and devices.
segment.target: The count of installed applications and devices.

segment.source: The count of installed applications and devices that have issues.
segment.target: The count of installed applications and devices that have issues.

segment.source: Using the Device Dialog Box
segment.target: Using the Device Dialog Box

segment.source: In the Device dialog box, you can perform the following actions:
segment.target: In the Device dialog box, you can perform the following actions:

segment.source: Assign categories and subcategories to the device.
segment.target: Assign categories and subcategories to the device.

segment.source: For more information, see Categorizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Categorizing Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Specify the importance of the device to your organization.
segment.target: Specify the importance of the device to your organization.

segment.source: For more information, see Prioritizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Prioritizing Your Compatibility Data.
